race.name: "Bridge to Brew"  Half Marathon and 5K
race.description:
Join us for the 2nd Bridge to Brew Half Marathon and 5K in downtown Port Huron. Be part of the "Quay street experience" near the Start/Finish area. 

Our course will run along the blue waters of the St Clair river and Lake Huron. Both races are an out and back. We will have water stations every 2 miles along half marathon. We will be giving away commemorative pint glasses at finish line. We will also have live music at start/finish area along the banks of the Black River. All  finishers will also receive a finisher medal.

Packet pick up will be Sat August 10th from 12-5 at Bootleggers Axe Co, 402 Quay St. Also starting at 6:00 am race morning near start/finish area on Quay St. 

Eastside timing will provide timing services

race.name: "First In State" Fun Run 2023
race.description:
The "First In State" Fun Run is hosted by the cadets in the '89er Battalion, Guthrie High School JROTC. The Guthrie JROTC program is the first JROTC program in the State of Oklahoma, dating back to 1935. As a fun run, we encourage competitive runners, recreational runners as well as walkers; walk your dog, push a stroller or simply enjoy the fellowship of your friends and neighbors. This a community fund raising event for the students and the proceeds will support educational and leadership training opportunities for the students in JROTC. A portion of the proceeds will support Veteran organizations and charities. 

LOCATION: The Start / Finish line is at Honor Park in Downtown Guthrie, near 301 West Harrison Avenue across from the Oklahoma Publishing Museum

RUN ROUTE: From Honor Park you will run right on Oklahoma Ave. to the Masonic temple (turn around point). You will return on Oklahoma Ave. and turn left on 2d Street. Run past the start / finish line along 2d Street then through Mineral Wells Park them back on 2d Street to the finish line. Total distances is 2.9 miles. Course marshals will be present along the run route. 

PARKING: NOTICE!!!! Harrison is closed at Division street. Turn west on Vilas to 2d or 3d street for parking. Park along Harrison Ave. west of 2d street, or on 3d street.

PRICING NOTE: This event is aged based.  You will see adjusted pricing at the end of registration.

0-5 FREE
6-18 $10
19 & up $20

This fun run will be held in conjunction with Guthrie's 89'er day parade and celebration. Come out for the parade, carnival, food trucks, and MORE!!
Oklahoma's '89er Day Celebration, is an annual April event commemorating Oklahoma's first land run on April 22, 1889. The City of Guthrie, site of much of the Land Run's initial settlement and the first Territorial Capital, held the inaugural '89er Day Celebration on the famous land opening's first anniversary.

Severe Weather Policy
Weather forecasts are tracked before the race for heavy rain, thunder and lightning, high winds, etc. If there is a possibility of threatening weather, information will be posted on the Guthrie JROTC Facebook Page and other event social media pages to alert participants of possible course changes.  No Refunds will be given if the event is cancelled due to severe weather.

race.name: "For Your Health" 5k Run/Walk & 1-Mile Fun Walk
race.description: Licking Memorial Health Systems exists to improve the health of the community.  The objective of the "For Your Health" 5K Run/Walk & 1 Mile Fun Walk is to offer a community event that encourages a healthy lifestyle.

race.name: "Free" Fleet Feet Fall Fitness Festival Fun Run
race.description:
The FREE Event is now sold out of shirts!  Must be present to receive the shirt!

"Free" Fleet Feet Fall Fitness Festival Fun Run.  The Fun Run will be 3 miles.  However, there are 10 miles of trails that you are welcome to explore.

First 250 to register will receive a custom shirt.  Supplies and sizes limited to those registered early.

This is a community Fun Run, no timing just fun and exploration!

Join us for a free family fun day all about fitness! We will have a community fun run, kids run, and bike ride, followed by a day filled with free pop-up fitness classes from some of your favorite local fitness studios!

There will be booths set up with giveaways, fitness studio information, free assessments, free personalized stretching, nutrition, IVs and Normatec compression therapy, yard games, food trucks, & more!

race.name: "Friends on the 4th" 5K
race.description:
2024 "Friends on the 4th" 5K 

Start the 4th of July off with a bang and join the gang at Central Maine's most popular race!

The "Friends on the 4th" 5K course is a forgiving, "feel good" race open for all runners, joggers and walkers.  After a loop through downtown Main Street, most of the course follows the beautiful eastern shore of Maranacook Lake.  

Awards:

Men & Women, 1st place awards for the following age groups: 10 & under, 11-13, 14-16, 17-19, 20-24, 25-29, 30-34, 35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69 70-74, 75-79 and 80+.  Awards, trophies, and other prizes are also provided for the overall M/F winners.  Certificates will be presented to all participants 10 years of age & under.  Great assortment of individually packaged food and water along with a raffle of gift certificates and items donated by local merchants is provided at the end of the race to ALL those who have registered.  

Payment and registration form must be received by Sunday, June 25, in order to guarantee a race T-shirt and goodie bag.  Online registration is open until 4:00 pm on July 3, 2024.  Last minute registration on race day may begin at 7:00 am* at the American Legion, 117 Bowdoin Street, and ENDS at 7:45 am.  A $35 entry fee will be charged, and we cannot guarantee T-shirt and goodie bag for last minute registrations. Any extra T-shirts and goodie bags will be handed out on a first-come, first-served basis.  *Same day registrations may be limited or not available depending on state of Maine regulations, so PRE-REGISTRATION IS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Registration forms can also be downloaded from the Friends website:  www.watershedfriends.com  

Fundraise for the Friends!  Interested in helping out your "Friends" even more?  Fundraise as an individual or as a team to raise additional funds to help keep our local waters as clean as possible.  Prizes will be awarded to the top individual and the top team fundraisers.  

Questions?  Contact the Friends office at 207-395-5239 or via email cami@watershedfriends.com For the safety of runners, parking is not allowed along the race route.  Parking attendants will guide participants & spectators to designated parking areas.

race.name: "HIT THE TRAILS"  5K RUN/3K WALK
race.description:
Howard -  Suamico Optimist Club Presents:

"Hit the Trails" ... Choose Health & Happiness 5K Run/ 3K Walk

• Registration begins at 7:30am

The Lodge at the Camp is located by the Upper Parking Lot (adjacent to the new and exciting Adventure Course), with just a short walk down the path to the NEW Zoo entrance.

RAIN OUT : Pushes to 2025

PROCEEDS BENEFIT NEW ZOO YOUTH PROGRAMS

race.name: "IRISH" I Was Faster
race.description:
Imagine how great you feel when you have completed a work out.  That good tired feeling.  What images of yourself come to mind when you perform an act of kindness for others?  Do you feel warm, heroic, accomplished?  All of the above and more? The IRISH I Was Faster will help you get that good tired feeling and generate a sense of selflessness.  As runners and walkers, we know that sports keeps us healthy and teaches us many life lessons.  YOU can support young people to stay healthy and learn important life lessons through sports.

The "IRISH" I Was Faster is a 4K Run/Walk that supports the Imlay City Athletic Boosters.  The Athletic Boosters works to support the athletes of the Imlay City Schools.  Funds from this race will be used to provide for team needs such as gear, uniforms, equipment, and the HUDL system so that they have the tools needed to be successful to excel in the sport they are participating in.  HUDL provides video review and performance analysis tools for sports teams and athletes at every level. 

This race will take you around the Imlay City Schools from the high school where the athletes spend their school day as well as the Middle School, Weston St. Elementary and Borland Elementary.  The route will also take you through the baseball grounds, track and football field.  As a participant you will have the opportunity to see the grounds and buildings that you are providing support for.  

Most people struggle with the amount of races to choose from, at the IRISH our fun and welcoming volunteers ensure your anxiety on race day is only those pre-race jitters.  At the IRISH you will feel like your are competing in your own hometown.

race.name: "Live Your Dash" The Dee Smith Memorial 5K Fun walk/run
race.description:
Dee Smith, a lifetime Ogden resident and a Weber County leader, was a proponent of keeping our community safe. As a former county prosecutor, leader, mentor, and teacher, Dee was a diligent civil leader to local law enforcement officers.

Dee passed away unexpectedly in June 2021 and left behind a legacy of hard work along with his amazing family and countless friends. Dee was passionate about being active and loved biking, running, hiking, and any outdoor activity under the "Blue Dome." He lived life to the fullest, by living "his dash," and is greatly missed.

The purpose of the race is to honor Dee's memory and a make a thoughtful donation to support local programs important to Dee.  Last year, donations and race proceeds topped $22,000 and went to Weber State University for Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice scholarship programs. In addition, a new “Live Your Dash” Summer Reading Program is being developed to help struggling children with reading assistance. We couldn't have done it without you and this year we are hoping for it to be BIGGER and BETTER with your continued support!


Your race fee(s), donations, are tax deductible.  We will email you a donation receipt.  Please keep your receipt as it is your official record to claim your donation as a tax deduction. 

Thank you for being a part of Dee's legacy!  For more information, please contact us at : liveyourdashdeesmith@gmail.com.

Race Fees

  • Pre-Race Fee (must register by 4/30/2023 to guarantee T-Shirt)
    • Adults (18 and older) $25.00.  Registration includes a commemorative shirt.
    • Youth (5 to 17 year old) $10.00.  Registration includes a commemorative shirt.
    • Children (4 and under) Free- No shirt Included
  • Late Registration ( after 4/30/2023)
    • Adults (18 and older) $25.00. T-shirts are not guaranteed; subject to availability
      Youth (17 and under) $15.00. T-shirts are not guaranteed; subject to availability
      Children (4 and under) Free
  • Day of Race Fee:
    • Adults (18 and older) $25.00. T-shirts are not guaranteed; subject to availability
    • Youth (17 and under) $15.00. T-shirts are not guaranteed; subject to availability
    • Children (4 and under) Free
  • First place winners (male, female, male and female youth) will win a commemorative keepsake

race.name: "LOOP THE LAKE" The Great New York State Marathon Weekend
race.description:
LOOP THE LAKE!!   A celebration of the Great State of New York, Races passes through a beautiful tree lined course that loops around Onondaga Lake.  The weekend kicks off the morning of Saturday October 20th with the 5k and 10k runs. Then continues the morning of Sunday October 121th with the full and half marathon's. 

EXCELSIOR CHALLENGE!  Test your endurance and achieve New York State acclaim! When you complete both a Saturday and Sunday race (5k/10k and half/full marathon) you'll earn the prestigious Great New York EXCELSIOR Challenge Medal - in addition to your 5k/10k finisher and half/full marathon medals.

Sign up for one of our Excelsior Challenges and hit the trifecta of medals!

Marathon Relay!  Invite your running buddy to join our latest race.  A Marathon relay comprising of 2 runners, each running a half marathon to complete a full marathon relay.  the race starts the same time as the Marathon with the hand off at the half way mark.  Twice the runners, twice the fun.

race.name: "Miles That Matter" 5K & 10K  Run/Walk
race.description:
Come out on July 15th 2023 for our annual, ACTS Miles That Matter Run/Walk 5K 10K.  Our run/walk is a beautiful course in Warsaw, IN.  Both distances will give you a view of Pike Lake and include an amazing finish as you go through the Beyer Farm trail.  Runners and walkers have said this is a wonderful course and can't wait to participate each year.  Water will be available throughout the course.  

The 5K and 10K is a timed race and your race results will be available to you quickly and accurately.  We are proud to have 5 year age groups in the 5k; Awesome medals for the top 3 in each age group.  In the 10K it is a 9 year age group with top 3 in each age group receiving medals.  There will be finisher awards for all distances. We will have overall winner Awards for male and female for both the 5K and 10K distances.  

 

Refreshments, fruit, cookies, will be ready for you after your finish.

We have TH Timing assisting in our event and are the best in the area at run/walk events.

Come run or walk to help families in our community and families in Haiti.

  There is an entry fee for online registration and taxes.  

Pre-registration is open now until July 9th.  Includes t-shirt and fee is  $25 plus fees.  After July 9th  registration is $30 plus fees and no shirt is guaranteed.

5K age group: 14 & under; 15-19; 20-24; 25-29; 30-34; 35-39; 40-44; 45-49; 50-54; 55-59; 60-64; 65 & over

10K age group: 16 & under; 17-25; 26-34; 35-43; 44-52; 53 & over.

race.name: "Racing to Save Lives " 5k/10k
race.description:
Runners will run on a mixture of carriage path, single track, grass field, and road surfaces .

All proceeds will go to the Dana Farber Cancer Institute .

race.name: "Run For A Vet"
race.description:
Sponsored by Branson Veterans of America 913 (BVA913) to honor our Veterans. This race helps to raise money for veterans that are in need.   

The Branson Veterans of America 913 is a not-for-profit corporation dedicated to support all American veterans, focusing on helping veterans and their families from all areas of service.  We do this by:

1.      Promoting honor to all who have patriotically served our country in any of the Armed Forces of the United States of America through organization and support of public gatherings and ceremonies.

2.      Supporting education of patriotism, duties of citizenship, and honor of our Flag through the organization’s scholarship program, support and encouragement of local educational institutions for patriotic education, and individual conduct within the communities.

3.      Assisting fellow veterans and their families through physical and economic response to special needs, encouragement and support for a healthy lifestyle, and a sense of community.

4.      Working in partnership with local government and private agencies to assure an environment for safe and secure living for all veterans and their families.

                                                      BRANSON VETERANS OF AMERICA 913 VISION STATEMENT:

The Branson Veterans of America 913 vision is to be a prominent organization for ensuring veterans of all eras are respected for their service and for promoting honor for the United States of America.

Location: Dewey Short Visitors Center, 4500 State Hwy 165 Branson, MO

Packet Pickup Friday 5-7pm. Race day registration from 6:00 to 6:30am. (Located at the beginning of the running trail)

Half Marathon will begin at 6:45am – 5K will begin at 7:30am

Race Course: Dewey Short Visitors Center to Lakeshore Trail to State Park Marina

(Asphalt surfaced trail)

Fast, out & back course; with a scenic view of Table Rock Lake every step of the way!

* 5K will be one loop of 3.1 miles & Half Marathon is 3 loops of 4.36 miles each

Information: Race Director - Alex Penrod 417-263-0411 (alexpenrod@gmail.com)

 

Awards for each race: Trophies to Overall Male & Female; Overall Masters Male & Female (40 and above)

Age group awards (Male & Female) 14 & under, 15-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60+

Awards for 5K will be at 8:30am, Half Marathon awards will be after the last runner comes across the finish line.

All race proceeds will go to the Local Branson BVA913 Chapter. (All payments are final)

race.name: "Run for the Girls" 5K / 10K
race.description:
"Run for the Girls" is a fundraiser for the

Girls Shelter of Fort Smith, Inc

Where sheltering is just the beginning

 

USATF Certified course - chip timed.   All age groups welcome.


T-shirts for entrants registered before April 22, 2024. 

If you missed this deadline and would like a T-shirt, extras available on race day while supplies last.

Early Registration and pickup - 4:00pm till 6:00pm on May 3rd @ 7308 Ellis - The Barracks @ Chaffee Crossing

Registration on the morning of the race May 25,2023 starting at 7:00am till 8:00am

 

ABOUT US

The Girls Shelter of Fort Smith - A United Way Community Partner - opened in 1970 as a temporary emergency shelter. Since then, the Shelter has developed and grown onto a long-term residential treatment facility. In April 2002, a new 7,000 square-foot facility was built on a two-acre lot at South 26th and Quincy. The shelter is licensed for eight girls, ages 12 – 17 years old. During the Summer, our girls will volunteer for one of our sponsors United Way and their agencies. 

The Girls Shelter strives to develop its residents into responsible citizens and community members. The girls are:

  • Taught social and independent living skills.
  • Given a sense of self-worth and taught to be responsible for their actions and decisions.
  • Taught job skills and money management by working summer jobs.
  • Required to attend and take an active part in school.
  • Given individual treatment plans including structured goals and objectives.
  • Provided counseling.
  • The long-term goal of the Girls Shelter is to reunite the resident with her family.

OUR MISSION

Our mission is to provide a safe and encouraging atmosphere in a residential setting for at risk females aged 12 – 17 years; to promote positive behaviors, character enhancement, educational advancement, and to reunite with family.

Many of our residents have had a less than desirable childhood. Common histories include physical and sexual abuse,
parents with drug issues, parents in prison and homelessness.

We teach personal responsibility, independent living skills and positive social skills. We provide case management,
individual and family counseling.

We provide a safe home environment, all food, transportation, personal items, and clothing. They receive individual and family counseling.

As one Board member put it, “we have one year to pour all the good into them we can possibly give them”.

race.name: "The Race"
race.description: Testing

race.name: "Using our Voices" Mental Health Run Series - Center Moriches
race.description:
This student-led run series was created by Center Moriches Student Leaders as a follow up event to PS I Love You Day and the first annual Student-Athlete Leadership Conference they hosted for Section XI this year. 

PS I Love You Day is held the second Friday of February. It is a day meant to spread love, decrease bullying, and promote mental health awareness. This day was created by Brooke and Jaimie DiPalma after experiencing a family tragedy where their father took his own life. The sisters lost the glue that bonded their family and felt that “tragedy should not be the force for togetherness; Togetherness should be the force that ends tragedies.” So, in memory of their father, they began an incredibly positive movement that has now spread throughout the world.

Center Moriches School District believes in students being a part of the change process and genuine inclusivity through student engagement. Students across the island have collaborated to create the first annual, “Using our Voices” Mental Health Run Series. The goal is to share important messages about, reducing stress and anxiety, building relationships, and supporting students’ mental and physical health through movement. Giving students an opportunity to use their voice and leadership skills, and work toward the first ever NYS Seal of Civic Readiness for promoting civic mindedness within their communities. Students work towards an important cause by using their voices, having fun, and building a network of positivity across the island. 

Together with the North Babylon & Connetquot High School leaders, this event is one you will not want to miss! All students will be able to participate in the race series free of charge in an effort to spread awareness to a cause important to so many people. Join these students for the first ever student-led event series Long Island has offered. 

When kids are empowered, magical things can happen! 

 

Race Directors/School Contact for the Series: 

Center Moriches: Katy Forman, kforman@cmschools.org 

North Babylon: Meghan Kelly, mkelly@northbabylonschools.org 

Connetquot: Lauren Neckin, lneckin@ccsdli.org

race.name: "Walk A Mile In Her Shoes" Marshalltown
race.description:
Walk a Mile in Her Shoes® Marshalltown is a united gender movement where men will be a part of the solution to ending sexualized violence.

The mission of Walk a Mile in Her Shoes® is to co-create a united gender movement where men will be a part of the solution to ending sexualized violence by marching a mile in heeled shoes. Men participating in Walk a Mile in her Shoes® will provide their own heels for the event. Women are encouraged to wear tennis shoes.

This year's event is Saturday June 22, 2024, with registration beginning at 10 AM at the Echo [13th Street District].

From the Walk a Mile in Her Shoes National Organization

Each year, an ever-increasing number of men, women and their families are joining the award-winning Walk a Mile in Her Shoes®: The International Men's March to Stop Rape, Sexual Assault & Gender Violence. A Walk a Mile in Her Shoes® Event is a playful opportunity for men to raise awareness in their community about the serious causes, effects and remediations to sexualized violence. First You Walk the Walk: There is an old saying: "You can't really understand another person's experience until you've walked a mile in their shoes." Walk a Mile in Her Shoes® asks men to literally walk one mile in women's high-heeled shoes. It's not easy walking in these shoes, but it's fun and it gets the community to talk about something that's really difficult to talk about: gender relations and sexual violence.

Website to WAM: http://www.walkamileinhershoes.org/

race.name: #NFStrong- Boardman, OH
race.description:
Join us at the

12th Annual
#NFStrong 5K for Neurofibromatosis

Join the NF Network and members of our NF community as we rally in the fight against neurofibromatosis. Stroll, roll, walk or run... either way, come on out and have fun to celebrate 12 years in Boardman, OH!


#NFStrong events take place in communities nationwide. These inspiring events create strong bonds that build a supportive NF community. Invite your family and friends, meet others who are affected by NF, and raise funds for the NF Network. Our mission is to find treatments and a cure for neurofibromatosis by promoting scientific research, improving clinical care, providing outreach through education and awareness, while offering hope and support to those affected by NF.

race.name: #RUNMARANA Mother's Day 5k and Kid’s Free FUN Run
race.description:
On Your Left Fitness is proud to announce that we are partnering with the Town of Marana for its Marana Mother's Day 5k (1st of 5 #RUNMARANA Endurance Events).  Come get active as a family and honor all moms, grandmothers and moms-to-be at the Mother's Day 5k! 

The Course

Walk it, Jog it, Sprint it - 5k your way! The out-and-back route runs along the scenic Santa Cruz River path with refueling stations located at the start/finish line, and the 5K turn. The course remains entirely on the shared use path and is well-marked with triangle ground signs.

Be sure to capture the moment and post your pictures on social media using the hashtag: #RUNMARANA.

Race Day Schedule

7:00 am | Check-in
8:00 am | 5K Start
9:00 am | Free Kids Fun Run
9:05 am | A Toast to Moms

Race Details 

Custom Bibs | All registrations include a custom race bib and custom online finisher's certificate.
Finisher Medal | The first 200 participants to register will receive a finisher medal……hurry while they last!
Raffle | Two (2) Fitness themed prize packs will be raffled off for each race. Included with Reg.
Community activities | Themed face painting, photo booth, inflatables/lawn games, and a toast to moms.
Packet Pickup | Thursday, May 9, 4:00-6:00pm at the Marana PR Community Center (13250 N. Lon Adams Road)

A Toast to Moms

What makes a mom so special? Everything! Join us in celebrating moms with a cider toast after the race.

Race-Day Registration

You can register online on race day until 7:00 a.m. PLEASE USE YOUR COMPUTER OR CELL PHONE TO REGISTER. There will be NO PAPER registration on race day. Price increased on race day to $40. 

RaceJoy

The RaceJoy app will be available if you want to use it to receive cheers and directions on your run, or if your family and friends want to track you on race day. Results will be posted live on the event website, and you can sign up for text messaging.
Before you run/walk, consider downloading and using the RaceJoy App. On your event day, turn on RaceJoy, pick your route distance, hit start. When you're done, hit stop and save your results.
Like the Facebook Event Page and share your run/walk with us. We love pictures! 

#RUNMARANA (5 of 5)

The series includes five unique, fun, and challenging race events. Races are designed either as a trail race or road race each containing unique elements like mascots, community activities, or race course swag. All events are recreational and offer options for all fitness levels. Make Marana your place to run!

race.name: #RUNMARANA Tortolita Traverse Half-Marathon, 7 Miler, and MTB Races
race.description:
Your Trails. Your Run/Ride. Your Town

On Your Left Fitness is proud to partner with the Town of Marana Parks and Recreation to bring you the Tortolita Traverse, A challenging, yet breathtaking course in the Tortolita Preserve. Day 1 will feature the Half Marathon and 7 Mile run. Day two will feature a 10-mile and 20-mile mountain bike race.

The Course

Day 1 | Run the route! Challenge yourself to a half marathon on a mixture of single track trail and wash (sand) running or test your speed in the 7-mile Tortolita loop Course. 
Day 2 | Ride the Route! Prove your speed and have the fastest single or double lap.

Day 1 | RUN                                                       
6:00 am | Check-in (Campfire to keep warm)      
7:00 am | Half-Marathon Start
7:15 am | 7 Mile Start

Day 2 | RIDE
6:00 am | Check-in (Campfire to keep warm)
7:00 am | 10 Mile Start (1 lap) (6 bikes per flight 10 min)*
9:00 am | 20 Mile Start (2 laps) (6 bikes per flight 10 min)*

* Flights will be sent appx. every 10 minutes*

Tortoise Challenge                                             

Race our “Tortolita tortoise”! Beat the race time of our route director to earn a special finisher medal.                      

Day 1 RUN         | Half-Marathon x:xx.xx  | Six Mile x:xx.xx
Day 2 RIDE        | 20-Mile x:xx.xx              |10-Mile x:xx.xx

Dirt Hero Challenge

Crush the Dirt Dash Half Marathon trail run in the winter, slay the Tortolita Traverse Half Marathon trail run in the spring, and earn yourself the dirt hero shirt for completing the distance of a marathon through Marana trails.

The Details

Custom Bibs | All registrations include a custom race bib and custom online finisher's certificate.
Finisher Medal | The first 40 participants to register will receive a finisher Award……hurry while they last!
Raffle | Two (2) Fitness-themed prize packs will be raffled off for each race.

Mappy Hour!
Join us for Mappy Hours at Dove Mountain Brewery.  Mappy Hour will give you the chance to look over the course route with the opportunity to ask the race and route directors any questions you might have. After, you can grab your bib and race swag allowing you to skip the check-in line on race day and head directly to the start line.           

Race-Day Registration

You can register online on race day until 6:30 a.m. PLEASE USE YOUR COMPUTER OR CELL PHONE TO REGISTER. There will be NO PAPER registration on race day. Price increased on race day to $40. 

RaceJoy
The RaceJoy app will be available if you want to use it to receive cheers and directions on your run, or if your family and friends want to track you on race day.

Results will be posted live on the event website, and you can sign up for text messaging.

Before you run/walk, consider downloading and using the RaceJoy App. On your event day, turn on RaceJoy, pick your route distance, hit start. When you're done, hit stop and save your results.
Like the Facebook Event Page and share your run/walk with us. We love pictures! 

#RUNMARANA (4 of 5)

The series includes five unique, fun, and challenging race events. Races are designed either as a trail race or road race each containing unique elements like mascots, community activities, or race course swag. All events are recreational and offer options for all fitness levels. Make Marana your place to run!

race.name: #StayActive 5k
race.description:
The Union County Health Department is celebrating a healthy Union County by encouraging individuals to Stay Active Year Round!

Unfortunately, just like everyone else in the US, Union County's obesity rates are high, in our case higher than state and national averages. Unlike other areas, Union County has a nice network of trails and plans to expand them, so we would like to encourage people to get out and move no matter the weather or time of year!


Your call to action for the Stay Active Year Round campaign for the spring is to participate in the #StayActive 5k. The race starts at Mill Creek Park (by the soccer fields) and runs up the Jim Simmons Trail into Mill Valley North and then back over the pedestrian bridge. All proceeds benefit the Union County Health Department and allow us to provide mini-grants to local schools to encourage youth to learn life long health habits like running and walking!

 

Packet Pickup:
March 15, 2024
10:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.
Union County Health Department
940 London Ave #1100, Marysville, OH 43040

race.name: $5 5K
race.description: Pirate Perry Events & Fit.1 are ready to give back to our local running community....we just want to get everyone together for a 5K, have some fun, and reuse some race goodies!

race.name: '24 Crestview High School Psychology Club Fun Run
race.description: Welcome to the 2024 Crestview High School Psychology Club Fun Run! This will be our first race, and we are so excited to bring the community together to support a good cause. This year, our proceeds will go to Great Gains Behavioral Solutions! We hope that you are able to join us this year!

race.name: '32nd Annual' 4-Mile Super Bowl Sunday Race
race.description:
Join us for our 32nd annual 4-Mile Super Bowl Sunday race in Linwood Park! Lace up your running shoes for a fun run and start your Super Bowl celebrations on a healthy note. Challenge yourself with our 4-mile out-and-back course through Linwood Park. Burn off calories ahead of the super feast and come ready to cheer on your team fueled by endorphins and accomplished by completing the race! 

This year the 1st 200 registered participants will receive Run Wichita Arm Sleeves!

This will be a chip timed event.

Race time is 2pm on Sunday, February 11, 2024 with day-of registration opening at 12:30 inside the Linwood Park Recreation Center gymnasium.

race.name: 'til Valhalla 5k and Fun Run
race.description:
Los Alamos High School NJROTC invites you to come out and run for the awareness and prevention of veteran suicide.

Every day 22 Veterans commit suicide. Last school year our NJROTC cadets ran a combined 22 miles in support of life and to let our local Veteran's know their lives are important. As we move into the next year we wanted to make a bigger impact by hosting the 'til Valhalla 5k and Fun Run, in which all of our registration proceeds will be donated to Mission 22. Mission 22 is an organization that is committed to "provide extensive, personalized support and resources to help Veterans and their families thrive."

Not a runner but still want to do the full 5k because 1 mile just isn’t enough?Walkers are invited to participate in the 5k as well!

 

Proposed run route displayed in link above under “Race Website”. Run is out and back!

race.name: (aero) BLAZE your own path
race.description:
Join Fleet Feet Decatur and SALOMON for a race unlike any other!

Join us at Fleet Feet Decatur on February 15th at 6pm and don't be late.

At exactly 6pm we will release a map to each team (two people) and set a timer for 10 minutes. The maps will be marked with 4 undisclosed locations, you and your chosen partner will have 10 minutes to plan your route. When the timer goes off, the race clock starts! You must stop at each location, get a token, and get back to the store. You can also earn points along the way!

Ways to earn points:

Demo SALOMON shoes: 50 points

Complete the race: 30 points

Points per location visited: 10 points

Task at each location: 15 points

Team theme: 20 points

Live Documentation on Social: 25 points

10 pushups at each location: 15 point

There will be three ways to win: 

The team that makes it back first wins!

The team that runs the most effecienct route, least milage, wins! (gps required)

The team with the most points wins!

Visibility gear will be required for participation.

race.name: (Fun) Run for the Natural Areas 5K Trail Race
race.description:
IT'S FREE!!!

As part of the Natural Areas Festival, join us for the FREE 2024 (Fun) Run for the Natural Areas 5K Trail Race! The race again will be again at Winding Waters Natural Area which will give you the experience of one of the most authentic and gorgeous trail races in Palm Beach County! You’ll be amazed you’re a few short miles from the hustle and bustle of West Palm Beach!

The 5K course is a loop around the wetlands trail with a short trip through a wooded double-track fire road. It’s a beautiful course offering a huge variety of surfaces and scenery!

The Race for the Natural Areas aims to showcase the Palm Beach County Natural Areas. Winding Waters is an over 500-acre natural area containing a diversity of habitats, such as mesic flatwoods, hydric hammock, depression marsh, wet prairie, and dome swamp. Several areas were cleared for agricultural purposes and have been restored to shallow-water and deep-water marshes. 

The course itself will be a trail ringing the restored wetland offering scenic views of the teeming plant and animal life.

We have a capacity of 300 this year, so it remains a somewhat exclusive event and we expect it to sellout, once again!

Course Description
The 5K loop is a mix of shallow sand, grassy areas, and firm flatwoods. Despite being a challenging course, it flows fast! The sandy areas are shallow with only a couple patches of deeper, softer sand that you can get around very easily. There are no hills or water crossings.

Water/Restrooms
There will be two water stations along the route and there will be portable restrooms near the packet pickup table.

Timing
This will not be a timed race, this is a fun run to enjoy the wild & scenic Winding Waters Natural Area.

Awards/Medal
We will have trophies for Female & Male 1st - 3rd place.

Shirts
No shirts this year...it's free.

Race Day Schedule
2:00 pm: Natural Areas Festival starts
2:00 pm - 4:00 pm: Packet pickup
4:00 pm: 5K start
4:45 pm: Awards

race.name: *Spring Lake Memorial Classic* 2Mile / 5K / 10K
race.description:
RACE VIDEO PREVIEW 

The Spring Lake Memorial Classic is located in scenic eastern Hernando County, Florida. But don't let the majestic trees and peaceful setting fool you - these are some of the toughest hills in Florida! All three courses take participants along shade tree draped roads and over some very challenging hills! Make sure that the sound of your pounding heart and deep breathing don't distract you from observing the wonderful surroundings along the course. The area is home to a variety of native plants and wildlife such as majestic oaks, magnolias, hickory and cedar trees, red hawks, bald eagles, wild turkeys, pileated woodpeckers, bob cats, foxes, coyotes and white-tail deer - just to name a few.... So while doing this run be sure to keep your head high, breath deep and keep your eyes peeled - it truly is a treat for the senses! Proceeds from this event support individuals with intellectual & developmental disabilities. Come run Florida's toughest, most scenic, race course and Achieve with us!

PRICING:

Until 12/31/23:  2 mile - $15 / 5K - $20 / 10K - $25

1/1/24 - 2/29/24:  2 mile - $25 / 5K - $30 / 10K - $35

3/1/24 - 5/24/24:  2 mile - $30 / 5K - $35 / 10K - $40

AWARDS:
2 Mile Category - All participants are chip timed and receive a "Walking" medal. There are no age brackets.
5K & 10K - Age group awards are 3 deep in each 5 year age bracket for both male and female. Champion awards include; Masters ages 40+, Grand-Masters ages 50+ and Senior Grand-Masters ages 65 and over.  A runner may be eligible for only ONE award.  Male and female Over-All, Masters, Grand-Masters and Senior Grand Masters champions will be listed in their respective age group until the winners of all the Champion categories are determined. At that time their names will be removed from their age group standings. The remaining runners in those age groups will all move up in the standings. (Updated 2/24/21)

SCHEDULE:
Registration/Check-in: 6:30am - 7:30am
10K Start - 7:30am
5K Start - 7:40am
2 Mile Fun Run/Walk - 7:45am
Awards ceremony to immediately follow race.

address.street: The Arc Nature Coast - Brooksville Campus

race.name: ..............Nourish Your Sole............ Ty Spoor's Eagle Scout Project
race.description:
As a Boy Scout of Troop 209 I will be hosting a Free 5k Fun Run as my Eagle Scout Project.  My goal for the run is to have runners donate goods for the Catholic, non-profit organization, Pinellas Hope.  I would like to welcome runners and walkers as this is a Fun Run.  People of all ages can come out and enjoy this event.  Participants that use this sign-up page will receive their event Bib at St. Pete Running Company located at 6986 22nd Ave N in St. Pete on the day of the run from 7:30-8:00a.m.  The run will start at 8:00 and end at 10:00.  Some suggested items are listed below.  If you are unable to participate in the 5K Fun Run you can still bring donations by from 7:30-10:00 on February 17th.  I hope everyone gets to enjoy the run and Nourish Your Sole.

List of items needed, new or used: Towels/wash cloths, Twin air mattresses, Sleeping bags, Blankets, New Travel size toiletries (toothbrush/paste, bar soap), Reading glasses, Nail clippers, Duct tape, Paper plates, Plastic cutlery (mostly forks), Poncho’s, Laundry detergent sheets, Tarps, and Bed sheets (twin)

race.name: ...And the Beat Goes On
race.description:
Stuart Cardiology Group is proud to announce our first annual race event! On February 17th, 2024 starting at 7:30 AM, we will be hosting our first 5K walk/run.

We are aiming to raise awareness on the importance of cardiovascular health. A majority of the proceeds will be going to the American Heart Association.

Please feel free to walk or run the "...And the Beat Goes On" 5K event. This is a stroller friendly walk/run. We will also have an official clock and timing chips.

The course will be flat and certified starting at Stuart Cardiology Group's Office in Tradition Port Saint Lucie, FL. This is a stroller friendly race. There will be a souvenir race day shirt and goodie bag for participants. Finisher medals, placement medals and wonderful memories are to be had!

Space is limited for race day shirts and finishers medal....only 300 medals.

Reduced event fees: 
🦴 "Bare-Bones" registration. (No shirt)
👶 Ages 18 and younger. (Shirt and medal included)
🥽 Not able to make the event? Go VIRTUAL with our Virtual option and run the event at your comfort! (Shirt and medal)
🤝 Donations are always welcome and if you would like to sponsor the event, please contact us through the contact form for more information.

Age Bracket:
We will have placement awards for Male/Femal for the age brackets below.

  • 10-14
  • 15-19
  • 20-29
  • 30-39
  • 40-49
  • 50-59
  • 60-69
  • 70-74
  • 75-79
  • 80 plus.

We will also have an overall Male/Female placement award. 

 

PACKET PICK-UP:
Scheduled packet pickup on the following dates at our Port Saint Lucie office in Tradition.

ADDRESS:
11380 SW Village Parkway
Port Saint Lucie, FL 34987

DATE for packet pickup:
Feb. 15 & 16 from 3:30pm - 7:30pm
Feb. 17 6am - 7:30am (Before the start of the event)


We continue to look for sponsors to help make this a memorable event! Please use the contact form to see how we can collaborate on this great event!

 

💖 Every paid registration will be entered in a raffle for a prize from our sponsors.

CDW: Apple iPad 10.2 9th GEN
Dell: Dell Thunderbolt Dock, Dell Webcam, Dell Premier Multi-Device Wireless Keyboard & Mouse, Dell Premier Wireless Headset, Dell Premier Rechargeable Wireless Mouse, Dell EcoLoop Premier Backpack 15, Dell 64GB USB-A/C Combo Flash Drive, Dell 7-in-1 USB-C Multiport Adapter.

race.name: .5k Junk Run - A Race for the Rest of Us
race.description: What is better than a 5k run? A half-a-K run where you have junk food booths and prizes at the end. This race isn't for fitness buffs - it's a race for the rest of us! Goody bags and t-shirts will be part of the package! $25 for 15 and over. $15 for 10 to 14 and $10 for under 10. Babies in strollers are free. Can you run 1640 feet for donuts, junk food, and prizes? Sign up!

race.name: .5K Silly Walk
race.description: A silly fun run for everyone! Wear your silliest costume and practice your silliest walk for this fun trip around Promenade Park. Stop at the various aid stations featuring samples of beer and wine for 21+, flavored popcorn, pizza, hot chocolate, and cookies for everyone. T-shirt included with pre-registration. Awards for Silliest Walk and Silliest Costume.

race.name: 1 Mile Randall Carter Family Fun Walk
race.description: Lets all get together as one and go out for a healthy walk around our surrounding neighborhood.  Join us for this 1 Mile Family Fun Walk on Saturday April 20th, 2024.  Bring the Strollers, bring the dogs. Let's start spring off in a Healthy Way! Stay afterwards for some fun activities that we have planned!

race.name: 1,000 MILES Conquest Challenge 2024
race.description:
WE ARE BACK!
The challenge is to CONQUER 1,000 miles of distance in 2024!
There are 6 ways to complete your 1,000 Miles Conquest! All activities get converted to RUNNING miles, here are the ratios:

  1. RUN, SPRINT, JOG or WALK (1:1) - every mile on your feet will count straight
  2. SWIMMING (1:4) - for every ONE mile of swimming will count for FOUR miles of running
  3. BICYCLING / SPINNING (5:1) - FIVE miles on bicycle count for only ONE mile of running.
  4. ROWING (1:1) - ONE mile of rowing counts for ONE mile of running.
  5. ELLIPTICAL (1:1)
  6. RUCKSACK RUN with at least 40 pounds (1:2) - you can also use a weighted vest but it has to be at least 40 pounds too. Or be badass and count even a heavy ruck straight.

How are we tracking our conquest?

  • TRACK YOUR CONQUEST! Use your favorite app such as MapMyRun, Nike Run, Garmin, Adidas, Strava, or running shoe or watch that can track GPS. 
  • Log your miles directly into the RunSignUp system. When we all post our progress, we can share our progress, motivate others and track where we at in the challenge.
  • POST, SHARE, MOTIVATE! In our the Facebook group. Share a screenshot of your run, photos of your watch or treadmill screen, share your app's progress, etc... Give proof that you are doing it and share with the rest! While nobody doubts anybody the point is to interact and celebrate each other success and journey... so post away!
  • NO STEPPING allowed. If you track your whole day's worth of walking around or how many steps you took during that day, that doesn't count. The point of the challenge is to get out there, outside your routine, and by design, cover conquer the 1,000 miles distance. For example, walking around the mall and tracking your steps is a NO GO. In the end, this conquest relies on honor system and we are all honestly pushing each other through interaction about a common conquest in mind.
  • SHARE a RUNFIE, SELFIE, all the great SCENERY of your favorite: RUNS, SWIM, RIDE, HIKES, and of course when you are RUCKING!!! Share with other Conquerors your journey and motivate them into theirs.
  • INVITE AS MANY FRIENDS AS YOU LIKE but motivate them to keep posting and recording their conquest... don't get lazy!

race.name: 1,000 Strong Overcoming Obstacles 5k/10k
race.description:
Restoration House Ministries' race features permanent structures, pop up challenges, and mud pits that will not only give you a great work out but also satisfy that inner desire to OVERCOME! These same obstacles that will be used for health, well-being and competition will be a symbol of how we can overcome all of our obstacles with God's love working though our community. And in doing so, you will be supporting young women & men in overcoming their obstacles of trauma, abuse and addictions and helping put the homeless in our community on a path to restoration. Appreciate electronic timing, live race results, health & wellness vendors, food trucks, and more.

Visit our website (restorationhouseministries.org/5k-event) for early bird pricing!

race.name: 1-Mile Challenge Training Program
race.description:
Join us for a fast paced 4 week training program to help you improve your 1 mile time! Or this program can help you in your quest to finish a 1 mile walk or run! Whatever your goal is, this program will get you to the finish line…fast! This training offers 2 weekly training sessions which consist of 2 group speed days! Your longer training runs will be done on your own during the week. 

At the end of the 4 week training, we will host a 1 Mile Speed Challenge event to crown the fastest 1 miler in Cherokee County! We will also crown the most improved 1 mile from the start to the end of the 4 week training period! So, dust off those shoes, lace up those spikes, we are ready to go!

Learn more about the training program at the informational meeting on Monday, August 5th, or Thursday, August 8th, 2024. Both meetings will be at 6:30 p.m. at Fleet Feet Canton (1431 Riverstone Parkway, Canton, GA 30114).

race.name: 10 & 20 Mile Training Run
race.description:
TRAINING RUN

A Free 10 & 20 Mile Training Run, brought to you by the University of Michigan Health-West Grand Rapids Marathon and Team World Vision. No Shirts. No Money. No race packets. Just a supported training run on a Saturday morning. We'll use parts of the marathon course, and lots of Millennium Park.

SIGN UP SO WE KNOW WHO ALL ARE COMING!! It helps us plan for supplies for the day. We'll draw for some prizes from the registered runners.

We'll be using the Community Room, inside the YMCA, for post run nutrition and social time. We'll have a couple of our awesome sponsors on site, available to chat. This is where we will do the drawing for prizes, drawn from those who registered.

Pacers? Yes! Many of our pacers who will be pacing you on October 20th, will be on hand for this training run, with pace signs. This would be a great time to connect and do your training run with the pacer you may have on race day!

race.name: 100 Laps of Healing
race.description:
Join us on Sunday, May 5th, 2024 as Dan Wolen will be running 105 laps (26.2 miles) on the HHS Track and our entire community is invited to come out and join him.

Be a part of the message of love and support to those in our community facing a medical crisis by logging a few laps around the track. We invite your entire family, all fitness levels, young and old, to come out and be a part of this event. Consider surprising us with your inner wild by wearing something crazy fun! It is Cinco de Mayo after all! 

Lanes 1-3: Reserved for Runners
Lanes 4-6: Reserved for Walkers (no strollers, no dogs unless medically needed)

Register online (It's free but donations are welcome)
Arrive at the track anytime between 7 AM and 11:00. 
Receive a bib that will count your laps for you. (NEW IN 2024)
Start walking or running!

We finally broke a 7-year record in 2023 and completed 5,754 laps or 1438.5 miles. Do we dare set a goal of 6,000 laps in 2024? 

2024 will mark the 10th annual 100 Laps of Healing event. 

* No strollers and no dogs! (unless medically necessary)

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

  • Encourage friends to donate to your effort. (Flat donations and per lap pledges accepted)
  • Be an event sponsor to bring your own tent, table and signage to put track side.
  • Make a general donation to Dan just because he’s awesome and running 100 Laps of Healing on the track.
  • Start a fundraising page to raise funds for Steps Together with your own laps!
  • Volunteer
  • Donate food, baked goods or water for our participants.

race.name: 1000 Mile Challenge - 2024 Midwest
race.description:
MAKE THE YEAR-LONG COMMITMENT TO RUNNING!

Join RunWell on the 1000 MILE CHALLENGE, Midwest edition!  It's exactly what it sounds like.  Run 1000 miles in 2024 and get sweet prizes on January 1, 2025 at the Resolution Run (participants not located in our geographical area will receive their swag in the mail after the Challenge is completed). You can also include any "purposeful" walking (Note: daily activities, work, errands, should not be counted)!  

Complete the Challenge and you'll earn cool swag on January 1, 2025! We have a custom RunWell 1000 Mile Challenge belt buckle and performance shirt for all Challenge finishers!

We will track your mileage through the website and app TrainingPeaks.  If you already have an account, attach to Coach Jen Schaller.  If you don't have an account, we will email a link to you with login information.  Wear your Garmin during your run and simply "upload" the data after the run.  You can also prove your mileage through other apps that you already use: MapMyRun, Strava, etc.  (You will be asked to provide mileage totals on a monthly basis.)   

Register today! Price increases on Jan. 15th!

Now, let's log some miles and earn SWAG!

race.name: 103rd Statuto Race
race.description:
Running strong for 100 years!
The Statuto Race commemorates the creation of the first Italian Constitution (Statuto Albertino) and is a running tradition in San Francisco going back more than 100 years. Join us in 2024 for the 103rd running of this iconic race!

Celebrate post-race with brunch!
The Bottomless Mimosa Brunch is back! Following the race, join us for brunch in the SFIAC Ballroom! Runners/walkers and guests welcome. $40 per adult. Kids 5-18 years are $20 per person (no charge for kids under age 5). You can purchase brunch tickets during registration or on the Store page in the menu bar above.

Awards!
• For the 8K run, trophies will be awarded to the first overall male runner, first overall female runner, and the first SFIAC dues-paying club member.
• For the 8K run, medals will be awarded to the 1st, 2nd and 3rd place in the following age groups (male and female divisions): 19 and under, 20 - 29, 30 - 39, 40 - 49, 50 - 59, 60 - 69, 70 - 79, and 80+.

race.name: 108 Challenge
race.description:
Inspired by 108 Classic Sun Salutations on International Yoga Day and Summer Solstice…

It's here!  Join the 2024 If So Inclined Virtual 108 Salutations Challenge going on during the month of March from the New Moon on the 10th to the Equinox on the 20th to the Full “Worm” Moon on the 25th, see who can complete the challenge(s). Choose one event, two events or take the Ultimate Challenge and go for the Trifecta! 

If getting out on your yoga mat is not enough of an excuse to join, compete for the glory of being a champion with a swag bag sent to all! 

The 108 Challenge

What’s your 108 Challenge?

Scheduled Virtual Events include:

“The 54+54”: 54 Sun AM + 54 Moon PM

“The 108+108”: 108 Sun AM + 108 Moon PM

“The Classic 108 Sun”: 108 Sun

“The Modern 108 Moon”: 108 Moon

“The Ultra 108 Full Moon2Equinox”: 108 Sun + Moon over 9 days ~Harvest Moon to Equinox Weekend

“The Adventure 108s”: 9 rounds of Sun + Moon in 9 separate locations (1 round per location)

“Free” Fundraising “Fun Run”: 9 rounds of a salutation of 12 poses, on one day, or over 9 days; ($36 fundraising min.)

Duathalon: choose two

Trifecta: choose three

What’s your 108 challenge? 

More information can be found on our website:

https://ifsoinclined.com/108challenge

race.name: 10k at 10,000 Feet
race.description:
Voted best 10k in the state of Colorado by Colorado Runner Magazine in 2010!

This is a challenging trail run with beautiful terrain and breathtaking scenery. The 10K race begins at 10,000 ft at the summit of Rabbit Ears Pass. The course begins by heading uphill on USFS dirt roads and 2 track, and then then heads downhill on single-track, ending on a cross country single-track. The total elevation gain and loss are about ~1,200 feet each.

*Although this race is listed as a 10k, the actual distance comes out to 6.8 miles. We will have one aid station on the course about 3.4 miles in (the 5k race option does not have an aid station). We HIGHLY recommend that you bring your own water.

address.street: Summit of the old Rabbit Ears Pass Road, Monument Parking lot

race.name: 10K Run for Music
race.description:
The Friends of Artis—Naples will present a 10k run/walk benefiting Artis—Naples’ youth education programs on Saturday March 23.

The out and back course begins and ends at Artis—Naples and runs through beautiful Pelican Bay.

Packet Pick up: March 22, 2024 10am-5pm Naples on the Run (20 10th. St. S. Naples Fl. 34102)

Registration includes singlet & finisher medal

Age Group 5 Deep, Master, Grandmaster, Senior Grandmaster

10K Event Pricing

$30 through Feb. 29

$35 until Race Day

$40 day of registration

race.name: 10K Run Thru History
race.description:
Join us for the 13th annual Rappahannock Area YMCA's Run Thru History 10K.

The historic run through Spotsylvania Courthouse Battlefield will take place on October 15th at 8am. This race will begin and finish at the Spotsylvania Courthouse Village Pavilion, 9019 Old Battlefield Blvd., Spotsylvania, VA 22553. Come and enjoy this 10K with a group of friends. In person event: must average 15 min/mile or faster.

Price increase and T-shirt deadline: Register before midnight on Sunday, September 24th for t-shirt guarantee and before the event price increases.

Runners will receive tons of additional perks including:
Race Day Photos
Real-time Results
Long Sleeve Technical Shirt
Post-Race Refreshments

race.name: 10K Test Race.
race.description: Test Race for RunScore
